p: Clove essential oil was more effective against A. alternata, whereas cinnamon essential oil was more active against C. hawaiiensis ( Table 2 , Figures 1 – 3). Both essential oils displayed a similar antifungal effect against F. proliferatum and F. oxysporum. Cinnamon and clove completely inhibited the growth of C. hawaiiensis to days 7 and 8 ( Figures 1 and 2). In model conditions assayed at 300 μg/mL, bay leaf essential oil showed no significant antifungal activity against the tested phytopathogenic fungi, whereas clove and cinnamon showed significant antifungal activity against all tested fungi, with a similar behavior pattern ( Figure 3 ).
